job_details.experience_required: At least 8 years of experience in Information Technology

jd: From: Ganesh Kathila, Siri InfoSolutions inc ganesh.k@siriinfo.com Reply to: ganesh.k@siriinfo.com Job Title: certified Product OwnerWork Location: Washington DC, no remote option Must Have: certified Product Owner with hands on experience in Safe Agile. Candidate must go to office in.Candidate must be from banking and financial services domain. experienced and SAFe certified POPM, preferably with experience in banking and financial services domainAt least 6 years of experience in banking domainRequired Qualifications:At least 8 years of experience in Information TechnologyMust be a Safe certified POPM – Certificate to be shared along with profile evaluation. Roles and Responsibilities:Prior experience working in SAFe Lean Enterprise Agile Framework.Develop and execute a product strategy for the Financial Services vertical that solves key member problems but also aligns with strategy of the Bank.Lead the entire product lifecycle of products, from ideation to launch, ensuring timely and successful delivery.Define and prioritize the product roadmap, making data-driven decisions to enhance user experience and engagement.Communicate product vision, strategy, and progress to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.Proven track record of successfully launching and managing digital consumer productsStrong analytical skills and ability to use data to drive decision-makingExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teamsDeep understanding of user experience principles and product design, specifically for insurance productsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneouslyPassion for financial technology and empowering individuals to improve their financial health through innovative solutionAct as Voice of the Customer internally, working closely with internal and external stakeholders to discover and analyse customer needs and shape these into clearly defined hardware and software requirements.Work with other Product Managers to prioritize the Product Backlog to ensure that all Product Backlog items are consistently scoped and sized to enable fair and timely prioritization.Experience in coordinating and facilitating software development sessions and teams including JAD, RAD, Distribution Resource Planning (DRP), SAFe 4.0 and 5.0, Agile Scrum and Kanban.Hands on experience in using ALM of tools such as JIRA, Azure DevOps. Kanban board, tracking of milestones etc.Ensure the team has a clear understanding of the vision and roadmap during both PI Planning and PI Execution.Actively participate in Agile Release Train (ART) Backlog refinement.Concepts and its application in – defining Objectives and Key results, definition of ready, definition of done for Epics, Features, User stories, INVEST framework, techniques for prioritization and sizing of features and user stories (T-shirt sizing, MOSCoW, WSJF, story points etc.) etc.
